data.text:
Kertész, Imre

Gályanapló. [Galley Diary.]

Budapest: Magvetö, [2002]. Signed by Imre Kertész on title page in blue ink. In publisher’s cardboard with the original, typographically illustrated dust jacket, printed in color. 359, (1) p. In fine condition.

Signed copy of Kertész’ 1992 fictional diary, Gályanapló (Galley Diary). Imre Kertész (1929–2016) was a Jewish Hungarian writer. In 2002 he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature for his 1975 book, Sorstalanság (Faithlessness), which is based on his experiences in the Auschwitz and Buchenwald concentration camps.
